question: Which artery is the main supplier of oxygenated blood to the brain?
short_explanation: The internal carotid artery is a major supplier of blood to the brain.
long_explanation: The internal carotid artery enters the skull through the carotid canal and forms part of the Circle of Willis, supplying critical areas of the cerebrum.
applied_example: A blockage here can lead to stroke symptoms like facial drooping or one-sided paralysis.
text: Which artery is the main supplier of oxygenated blood to the brain?

question: Which artery directly branches into the radial and ulnar arteries?
short_explanation: The brachial artery bifurcates into the radial and ulnar arteries.
long_explanation: At the cubital fossa near the elbow, the brachial artery splits into the radial (lateral) and ulnar (medial) arteries supplying the forearm and hand.
applied_example: Palpating the brachial pulse is standard in blood pressure assessments.
text: Which artery directly branches into the radial and ulnar arteries?

question: Which artery supplies the myocardium with oxygenated blood?
short_explanation: Coronary arteries supply the heart muscle.
long_explanation: The right and left coronary arteries branch from the ascending aorta and encircle the heart, feeding oxygen to the myocardium.
applied_example: Blockage in coronary arteries can cause angina or myocardial infarction (heart attack).
source_reference: Guyton and Hall Textbook of Medical Physiology
text: Which artery supplies the myocardium with oxygenated blood?

question: What is the name of the arterial structure at the base of the brain that ensures collateral blood flow?
short_explanation: The Circle of Willis is a ring of arteries that provides redundancy.
long_explanation: It connects the internal carotid and vertebral systems to provide backup circulation if one artery is blocked.
applied_example: Massage therapists should be cautious of vertebral artery syndrome during neck extension in certain clients.
text: What is the name of the arterial structure at the base of the brain that ensures collateral blood flow?

question: Which artery supplies the gluteal muscles and is a branch of the internal iliac artery?
short_explanation: The superior gluteal artery is the largest branch of the internal iliac.
long_explanation: It exits the pelvis via the greater sciatic foramen and supplies the gluteus medius, minimus, and tensor fasciae latae.
applied_example: Understanding gluteal artery location helps avoid deep tissue damage during massage therapy.
text: Which artery supplies the gluteal muscles and is a branch of the internal iliac artery?

question: Which artery passes behind the medial malleolus in the ankle and can be palpated for a pulse?
short_explanation: The posterior tibial artery passes behind the medial malleolus.
long_explanation: It provides blood to the plantar surface of the foot and is a common site to assess peripheral circulation.
applied_example: Posterior tibial pulse is checked in diabetic foot exams to monitor vascular health.
text: Which artery passes behind the medial malleolus in the ankle and can be palpated for a pulse?

question: Which artery is most likely to rupture in an epidural hematoma?
short_explanation: The middle meningeal artery is vulnerable with temporal bone trauma.
long_explanation: It runs beneath the pterion, a weak area of the skull, and can rupture causing rapid intracranial bleeding.
applied_example: Knowledge of this artery is vital when treating head trauma cases with neurological symptoms.
text: Which artery is most likely to rupture in an epidural hematoma?

question: Which artery is palpated at the wrist on the lateral side during a pulse check?
short_explanation: The radial artery runs lateral to the flexor carpi radialis tendon.
long_explanation: It is commonly used to measure pulse rate and assess peripheral perfusion.
applied_example: In massage therapy, avoiding excessive pressure on this area preserves vascular integrity.
text: Which artery is palpated at the wrist on the lateral side during a pulse check?

question: Which artery is the continuation of the external iliac artery after it passes under the inguinal ligament?
short_explanation: The external iliac becomes the femoral artery at the thigh.
long_explanation: It is the main arterial supply to the lower extremity and is commonly catheterized for cardiac procedures.
applied_example: In femoral triangle massage or stretching, therapists must avoid deep pressure near this artery.
text: Which artery is the continuation of the external iliac artery after it passes under the inguinal ligament?

question: Which artery provides the primary blood supply to the liver?
short_explanation: The hepatic artery proper is the main arterial supply to the liver.
long_explanation: It arises from the common hepatic artery, a branch of the celiac trunk, and enters the liver at the porta hepatis.
applied_example: Understanding hepatic perfusion is vital in massage therapy when applying pressure to the upper right quadrant.
text: Which artery provides the primary blood supply to the liver?
